titleStmt.title: L. L. Johnson et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6573

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To the HOnerable Govener
Bramlet of Kentucky

Sir whereas we under Stand that J. W. & F. M. McIntoshes whoe are citizens of Trigg County Ky was arreste and tried by a jury of this Trigg County on the 21st Day of June Last for a Breach of the peace & who ware find for Said offence have or will Petition your Honor to Remit their fine or a part theirof We the citizens Doe Demonstrate against Said petition Beleiveing that Sad McIntoshe had a fare trial and we are Infavier of Proscuting the Law. and gave to the Commowth and the Defendant Justice, this July 19th 1865

L L Johnson
Henry McIntire
J. F Calhoon
J R Lancaster
Those men had a fair and impartial trial & are not entilled in my oppinion to exacutive clemency

Jno. S. Spielsane
County Attoney
Peyton Thomas J. P.
C. H. Pugh
Carroll Thomas
T. J. Lancaster
G. C. Graham
W. A. Carr
Jordan Abernathy
W. Trion
William Calhoon
A-J Carr
Jackson Colson
Abe Holland
Samuel Holland
Morgan Hopson
John Turner
